choices.a: a system of government where a single individual rules
choices.b: a system of government where a small group of individuals are the rulers
choices.c: a system of government where the people in general rule over themselves

questions.question: According to anti-federalist 'An Old Whig,' the Constitution gives the national government too much power over states because:

choices.a: the national government was given the power to replace any state governments it declares are 'unrepublican'
choices.b: there will be far more national voters than state voters, and national voters will support the national government over the states
choices.c: there is practically no limit to the power of the national government to make any laws it wants to
choices.d: although the states can vote to 'nullify' federal laws, Congress can override that nullification by a mere 2/3 vote

questions.question: The Supreme Court case of Brown v. Board of Education declared that separate public schools for black and white children are:

choices.a: permissible as long as the schools are “equal” in funding, facilities, and other measurable qualities
choices.b: permissible unless students or parents at those schools objected
choices.d: impermissible in elementary/high schools but were permissible in college
